meta.title: COVID-19 FAQs - Dove Academy Dove Academy

meta.content: *We will continue to update this page as changes are announced* CLICK HERE to read a letter from our Area Superintendent IMPORTANT UPDATE: APRIL 2, 2020 – 4 PM. Dear Dove family, Today, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed Executive Order 2020-35, which orders all K-12 school buildings to close for the remainder of the school year …

h4.em: *We will continue to update this page as changes are announced*

h2.a: CLICK HERE to read a letter from our Area Superintendent

div.p:
Dear Dove family,
Today, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed Executive Order 2020-35, which orders all K-12 school buildings to close for the remainder of the school year — unless restrictions are lifted — and ensures the continuation of learning by setting guidelines for remote learning. It breaks my heart that we are not returning to our classrooms this academic year, but I know that our teachers are dedicated to working with you to educate our students during this unprecedented time. While teachers and students will not be returning to their classroom, our mission of educating and caring for students does not stop.

According to the Executive Order, The Michigan Association of Intermediate SchoolAdministrators and the Michigan Council of Charter School Authorizers are currently developing a continuity of Learning Plan template application for schools to utilize in order to create their localized plan. The application template will be made available to us by April 3, 2020.

As soon as we receive the template, we will adapt our distance learning plan and seek approval from our authorizer. The governor requested that our plans begin on April 28, 2020 at the latest. It is our hope that we implement distance learning no later than April 20, 2020.

Please note, all standardized tests previously scheduled for the remainder of the school year, including the M-STEP and the PSAT, will be canceled. All Michigan high school seniors will be given the opportunity to graduate this year so that they may make a successful postsecondary transition. All other students will be given the opportunity to earn course credit through a variety of means that best match course objectives.

By now, you should already have been contacted by your student’s teacher or other school personnel. If you have not been contacted, or need to update your contact information, please contact your teacher by email (available on the academy’s website). Additionally, please let us know if you need technology or technology support and we will try to provide resources for you.

You will receive more information on distance learning, homework guidelines or credit requirements, graduation, parent support, building access to retrieve your personal items and much more on April 13th .
div.h2: Are you in need of support or resources? Please call 2-1-1 from any phone to be connected to a list of statewide resources.
div.p: Good morning #DoveNation!
Detroit Parks and Recreation Department is offering free breakfast and lunch pick up at 3 of their locations.

Adams Butzel Recreation Center, 10500 Lyndon
Farwell Recreation Center, 2711 E. Outer Drive
Kemeny Recreation Center, 2260 S. Fort Street.
Parents and children can pick up breakfast and lunch Monday through Thursday between 8:30 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. On Fridays, they can request additional meals to get them through the weekend.
Dove Nation Families,

Grab N Go meals are available Tuesday-Thursday from 11a-12p outside of the main entrance! Dove staff members will continue to reach out to families daily to help support with remote learning. Thank you for your patience during this time! Stay safe, we will keep you updated as more information is received.
Dear Families,

Breakfast and lunch meals will be available at Dove Academy during the hours of 9am-12pm Tuesday- Thursday during the school shut down. Children or parents may pick up meals during these hours which will be pre-packaged to go. Multiple days meals may be picked up at a time for multiple students including meals for the weekend. All children 18 and younger are fully eligible regardless of whether they are enrolled in the school and regardless of free and reduced status.
Thank You,
Tommy Brooks
Principal

Dear #DoveNation Families, at this time we are following the direction of the Governor regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). Dove Academy will be closed Monday, March 16th until Sunday, April 5th in an attempt to slow the spread of the virus.
On Monday, March 16th, all Pre-K-8th grade families will be receiving messages from teachers via Class Dojo with online resources and materials to continue the learning process.
If you do not have access to technology please stop by the school on Tuesday, March 17th or Wednesday, March 18th from 9am- 12pm to pick up hard copies of the learning packets.
We appreciate your patience and flexibility during this trying time and will keep you updated as we receive more information.

Sincerely,
Mr. Brooks

h3.span: Important update: As of Thursday, March 12 at 11:00 p.m.

div.p: Governor Gretchen Whitmer announced that in order to slow the spread of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Michigan, she is ordering the closure of all K-12 school buildings, public, private, and boarding, to students starting Monday, March 16 until Sunday, April 5. School buildings are scheduled to reopen on Monday, April 6.

div.h3: Q: Is there a way my child can continue learning?
div.p: A: On Monday, March 16th, all Pre-K-8th grade families will be receiving messages from teachers via Class Dojo with online resources and materials to continue the learning process.
If you do not have access to technology please stop by the school on Tuesday, March 17th or Wednesday, March 18th from 9am- 12pm to pick up hard copies of the learning packets.
div.h3: Q: I’m concerned about providing food for my children, will there be any provided to my child by the school?
div.p: A: Breakfast and lunch meals will be available at Dove Academy during the hours of 9am-12pm Tuesday- Thursday during the school shut down. Children or parents may pick up meals during these hours which will be pre-packaged to go. Multiple days meals may be picked up at a time for multiple students including meals for the weekend. All children 18 and younger are fully eligible regardless of whether they are enrolled in the school and regardless of free and reduced status.
*Updated 3/16/2020
div.h3: Q: Will anyone be at the school building in case I need to drop off enrollment paperwork or pick up something from my student’s locker?
div.p: A: At this time, your school is working to offer times for families. Please keep an eye out for updated information as we know more.
*Updated 3/13/2020
div.h3: Q: What do I do if I or a family member is sick?
div.p: A: According to the CDC, you need to call your doctor: If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever and symptoms of respiratory illness, such as cough or difficulty breathing, call your healthcare provider immediately. Follow the steps in this link: If you are sick with COVID-19 or suspect you are infected with the virus that causes COVID-19, follow the steps below to help prevent the disease from spreading to people in your home and community. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/steps-when-sick.html
For additional questions on monitoring your health, contact your local public health officials (Michigan: 1-517-335-9030)
div.h3: Q: Are there any restrictions on personal travel?
div.p: A: The CDC has indicated travelers returning from (SEE BELOW) specified countries must stay home for 14 days after returning from travel, monitor their health, and practice social distancing. It is recommended staff and students utilize the free virtual COVID-19 screening through your healthcare provider, if you have any concerns you may need to self-quarantine. Please see the CDC travel health notices for an updated list of travel restrictions and guidelines.

div.div: Small classes give kids individualized attention.
We prepare our students to pursue a secondary education.
Seats are limited! Enroll your child online today!
School day start time? Questions about PreK? Find out here.

img.alt: Supported by Choice Schools Associates - Winner of the Detroit Free Press award Top Work Places for 2017 & 2018
img.p: Thank you for your understanding as we work to make our website ADA compliant.

Copyright 2020 Dove Academy of Detroit
20001 Wexford St., Detroit, Michigan 48234 | (313) 366-9110

Public Charter School Management Services Provided by Choice Schools Associates
Download Adobe Reader
Virtual Courses State Wide
